results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Wenona Byrne, Helen Pankhurst and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Two men in love, Barney (Joel Edgerton) and Dimi (Damian Walshe-Howling) head up to Sydney from Melbourne on a road trip. Whilst on the way, the boys make a stop at Bonegilla, a migrant camp used in the 1950’s where Dimi’s parents had first met and lived. They continue onto Sydney, where Barney’s father, an aged-hippie struggles with the day-to-day practicalities of “living” with a terminal illness. As both Barney and Dimi’s love for each other intensifies, they revisit past memories as they address new experiences that test a maturing relationship. Issues of race, drugs, sexuality and family are brought to the surface with an affecting warmth that endears us to the characters. Story and screenplay written by Christos Tsiolkas.

results.title: Saturday night live
results.creator_credit: Marci Klein, Michael Shoemaker, Beth McCarthy and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Saturday night live debuted on October 11, 1975, introducing to American television an irreverent type of comedy that parodied sitcoms, chat shows, news, entertainment shows and American culture. “SNL” frequently used scatological and satirical humour that was frequently accused of being offensive to mainstream audiences. The show served to introduce a slew of comedians to the entertainment arena, many of whom went on to have stellar careers in film and television. This DVD is the 25th anniversary special that was aired in 1999 and featuring, among others, spots from Tom Hanks, Adam Sandler, Lily Tomlin, Alec Baldwin, Chevy Chase, Jon Lovitz, Martin Short, James Van Der Beek, Molly Shannon, Jerry Seinfeld, Drew Barrymore, Kevin Spacey, David Spade, Mike Myers, Steve Martin, Garth Brooks, Michael Douglas, Candice Bergen and Dan Ackroyd. Also contains archival footage of famous skits taken from the history of the show, including performances by Christopher Walken, Chris Farley, Eddie Murphy, Dana Carvey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, John Belushi, Billy Crystal, Martin Short, Chris Rock, Al Franken, Madonna, Andy Kaufman and Bill Murray. The show featured many musical acts over the years and the highlights include: Elvis Costello, Sting, Steve Tyler, The Beastie Boys, Blondie, and David Bowie.

results.title: Satellites of the sun
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The science of film animation and new knowledge of outer space brings to the screen this spectacular, awe-inspiring view of our solar system. Staggering distances are eliminated through the art of film, and there, before our eyes, is displayed the wonder of the universe. The moon, Mercury, Mars, Saturn, Venus, Earth, the most favoured planet, and all the other satellites and lesser matter in space are seen in amazing detail and perspective, in their eternal orbits around the sun.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Satchmo
results.creator_credit: Gary Giddins, Kendrick Simmons, Toby Byron and Multiprises
results.brief_description: Louis Armstrong embodied 20th century American culture. No other performer of his era had such a profound effect as a singer as well as an instrumentalist. We hear over a dozen of his classic performances from 1932 to the late sixties, including numerous live concerts, television appearances and home videos.

results.title: Satan's choice
results.creator_credit: Donald Shebib, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A rare “inside” view of a motorcycle club in Toronto, one of the network of such fraternal groups in the large centres across North America. The names they adopt (Satan’s Choice is only one) are as individual as their special ethics and views of life, all freely expressed in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Shebib, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Sarah: the seventh match
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: This animated video tells the story of ten year old Sarah, who, separated from her family by the sudden outbreak of war, hides in the woods. She gradually adapts to her wild surroundings and becomes more like the forest creatures. Believing she can end the war by sabotaging a strategic railway bridge, Sarah begins the dangerous task of prising bricks from the bridge’s support columns. When her task seems hopeless and she is exhausted, spring floods bring ice floes crashing into the weakened columns, destroying the bridge. Sarah, her work done and now aware of mankind’s ability to hate and kill, returns forever to the forest and the creatures of the wild.

results.title: Sarah plain and tall
results.brief_description: Set in Kansas in 1910 this film concerns an independent woman, Sarah Wheaton (Glenn Close), who answers an advertisement for help wanted by a widower with two children in Midwest America. It is a transformation from the comfortable security of her seacoast home to the harsh terrain of the “wild west”. Also starring Christopher Walken, Lexi Randall and Margaret Sophie Stein. Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia MacLachlan.

results.title: Santiago's ark
results.brief_description: A New York tenement if Spanish-Harlem is not an easy place to live in. One moves fast and grows up quickly because that’s survival. But one learns to cope with the ghetto and sometimes can transform rubbish into beauty. Santiago’s Ark is such a place of beauty for a boy and his dreams. With endurance and help of the people around him, he sets about building his own ship on the rooftop of his apartment house.

results.title: San Francisco; Hollywood; Beverly Hills
results.brief_description: Hang ten at Huntington Beach or take a ski run at Big Bear. Discover history preserved in landmarks and revel in world renowned performing arts. See the vast variety of California’s lifestyle cities. Explore the hills and valleys of San Francisco: ride a trolley car, explore the Barbary Coast, enjoy museums, opera, symphony and distinguished cuisine on Fisherman’s Wharf. Travel to the bustling mega-tropolis Los Angeles and tour the infamous Beverly Hills and Hollywood, home to the rich and famous. Marvel at the sites and sounds of southern California - at the regions natural beauty from beaches to desert to snow-capped mountains. All without leaving your own lounge chair!

results.title: Samurai banners [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Hiroshi Inagaki, Tomoyuki Tanaka, Toshiro Mifune, Mifune Productions and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: One of the best samurai epics, “Samuarai Banners” tells the story of the 16th century warlord Takeda Shingen and his loyal general Yamamoto Kansuke (Mifune Toshiro), embedded in the story of the Takeda clan’s rise to power. Outstanding sets, costumes and Sato Masaru’s rich soundtrack make the drama highly enjoyable. The story is mainly seen from Kansuke’s point of view, and Mifune’s towering presence dominates the film. This is the final film directed by Hiroshi Inagaki, who specialised in period drama, particularly samurai films. The video cover includes information about Inakagi and Mifune as well as the context of the film. In Japanese with English subtitles.
